skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, or applications. Generates creative, polished code that avoids generic AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill wh...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only design guidance and frontend best practices. No code execution, file system access, or network requests - purely instructional content for guiding UI/UX implementation.

content.value_statement: Creates distinctive, production-grade web interfaces with bold aesthetic direction that stands out from generic AI-generated designs through intentional typography, color, motion, and spatial composition choices.
actual_capabilities: Develops complete working frontend code in HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other frameworks
Creates bold, distinctive aesthetic directions tailored to project context and audience
Implements sophisticated animations and micro-interactions using CSS and motion libraries
Designs unique typography pairings with characterful, non-generic font choices
Crafts cohesive color schemes using CSS variables with dominant colors and sharp accents
Builds unexpected layouts with asymmetry, overlap, and grid-breaking elements
Adds atmospheric backgrounds with gradients, textures, patterns, and visual depth
Ensures production-grade quality with attention to accessibility and performance constraints
limitations: Requires clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints for best results
Design quality depends on user providing adequate project requirements
Cannot generate backend functionality or data processing logic
May require iteration to match specific brand guidelines if not initially specified

use_cases.title: Landing Page Design
use_cases.description: Create a memorable landing page with bold aesthetic direction, sophisticated animations, and distinctive typography that converts visitors and stands out from competitors.
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams, startups, product managers launching new products or services

use_cases.title: Component Library Development
use_cases.description: Build a cohesive set of UI components with a unique design system, consistent theming, and polished interactions for use across a web application.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers, design system teams, product designers

use_cases.title: Portfolio Website
use_cases.description: Design a striking portfolio site that showcases creative work with unexpected layouts, creative motion, and an aesthetic that reflects personal brand identity.

use_cases.title: Dashboard Interface
use_cases.description: Create a functional yet beautiful data dashboard with thoughtful spatial composition, clear typography hierarchy, and refined minimalist or maximalist aesthetics.
use_cases.target_user: Product teams, SaaS companies, internal tool developers

use_cases.title: Marketing Campaign Microsite
use_cases.description: Build a temporary campaign site with extreme aesthetic choices, immersive animations, and memorable visual details that create buzz and engagement.
use_cases.target_user: Marketing agencies, brand managers, campaign coordinators

prompt_templates.title: Basic Component Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [component type] for a [industry/context] that feels [aesthetic direction]. The audience is [target users] and it should [primary function].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a single component with clear aesthetic direction

prompt_templates.title: Full Page Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [page type] for [product/service]. The brand is [tone/personality] and targets [audience]. Key sections include [list sections]. Make it feel [aesthetic direction] with emphasis on [design element].
prompt_templates.scenario: When designing a complete page with multiple sections

prompt_templates.title: Application Interface
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a [app type] interface using [framework]. Users need to [primary tasks]. The aesthetic should be [direction] to convey [feeling/message]. Technical constraints: [requirements].
prompt_templates.scenario: When building a full application with specific technical requirements

prompt_templates.title: Redesign Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Redesign this [existing component/page] to be more [quality]. Current version feels too [problem]. Target aesthetic: [direction]. Keep [elements to preserve] but reimagine [elements to change].
prompt_templates.scenario: When improving or refreshing existing frontend work

prompt_templates.title: Experimental/Creative Brief
prompt_templates.prompt: Create the most [extreme quality] [component/page] you can imagine for [context]. Push boundaries with [design elements]. No corporate constraints - make it unforgettable.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want maximum creative freedom and bold experimentation

output_examples.input: Create a pricing page for a developer tool that feels brutalist and raw
output_examples.output: Complete React component with stark monospace typography (JetBrains Mono), high-contrast black/white/yellow accent scheme, harsh borders, terminal-inspired layout with ASCII art dividers, no rounded corners, heavy use of CSS variables for theming, dramatic hover states with sharp transitions, and intentionally unpolished grid-breaking elements

output_examples.input: Build a portfolio hero section that feels organic and natural
output_examples.output: HTML/CSS implementation with soft, rounded typography (Newsreader for headings, Source Serif for body), earth-tone color palette with gradient meshes mimicking natural light, flowing asymmetric layout with overlapping elements, subtle grain texture overlay, gentle fade-in animations with staggered delays, and flowing hover effects inspired by water ripples

best_practices: Always start by understanding the purpose, audience, and tone before choosing an aesthetic direction
Commit fully to a bold aesthetic concept rather than hedging with safe, middle-ground choices
Match implementation complexity to aesthetic vision (elaborate code for maximalist designs, precision for minimalist)
Use CSS variables consistently for colors, spacing, and typography to maintain cohesion
Choose distinctive, characterful fonts instead of defaulting to generic options like Inter or Roboto
Create dominant color schemes with sharp accents rather than evenly-distributed palettes
Focus animations on high-impact moments with orchestrated timing rather than scattered micro-interactions
Break conventional layout patterns with asymmetry, overlap, and unexpected spatial composition
Add atmospheric depth through backgrounds, textures, gradients, and layered visual details
Vary aesthetic choices across different projects to avoid repetitive design patterns
anti_patterns: Using generic font families like Inter, Roboto, Arial, or system fonts without intentional reason
Defaulting to purple gradients on white backgrounds or other clichÃ©d color schemes
Creating predictable, cookie-cutter layouts that lack context-specific character
Implementing timid, evenly-distributed color palettes instead of bold, dominant schemes
Adding scattered micro-interactions without focusing on high-impact orchestrated moments
Using solid color backgrounds when atmospheric effects would add more depth
Applying minimal effort to minimalist designs (minimalism requires extreme precision and attention to detail)
Converging on the same aesthetic choices (like Space Grotesk) across multiple projects
Holding back creative vision due to assumed constraints not specified by the user
Treating all designs the same instead of tailoring aesthetic to specific context and purpose

faq.question: What frameworks and technologies does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports all major frontend technologies including vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other modern frameworks. It adapts implementation to your specified technical requirements while maintaining design quality across platforms.

faq.question: How do I get the best results from this skill?
faq.answer: Provide clear context about your project's purpose, target audience, and desired tone. Specify any technical constraints (framework, performance requirements, accessibility needs). The more specific you are about the feeling or aesthetic direction you want, the better the output will match your vision.

faq.question: Can this skill work within existing brand guidelines?
faq.answer: Yes, if you specify brand requirements (colors, fonts, tone) upfront, the skill will work within those constraints while still finding creative ways to make the design distinctive and memorable. Include any style guides or design system references in your request.

faq.question: What's the difference between minimalist and maximalist approaches?
faq.answer: Both require equal effort and intentionality. Minimalist designs demand extreme precision in spacing, typography, and subtle details. Maximalist designs need elaborate implementation with extensive animations, layered effects, and rich visual details. The skill matches complexity to aesthetic vision.

faq.question: Will the generated code be production-ready?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill focuses on creating functional, production-grade code with attention to performance and accessibility. However, you should review and test the output in your specific environment, especially for complex integrations or specific technical requirements.

faq.question: How does this avoid generic 'AI slop' aesthetics?
faq.answer: The skill deliberately avoids common AI design patterns by: choosing distinctive fonts beyond the usual suspects, committing to bold aesthetic directions tailored to context, creating unexpected layouts and spatial compositions, using atmospheric backgrounds instead of flat colors, and varying choices across different projects.

faq.question: Can I request specific aesthetic directions or styles?
faq.answer: Absolutely. You can specify directions like brutalist, art deco, retro-futuristic, organic/natural, editorial, industrial, or any other aesthetic. The more specific you are about the desired feeling and tone, the better the skill can execute that vision with precision.
